books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.description: A novel about the American dream and the disillusionment that comes with it.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: A novel set in the Deep South and focused on themes of racial injustice and moral growth.
A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.description: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation narrated by the protagonist Holden Caulfield.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.description: A philosophical book that tells the story of Santiago, a shepherd boy on a journey to discover his personal legend.

books.title: Brave New World
books.description: A novel that anticipates developments in reproductive technology, sleep-learning, and classical conditioning.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.description: A tale of passion and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.description: The narrative of Ishmael's whaling voyage, emphasizing the conflicts between man and nature.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.description: A narrative that explores the history of humankind from the Stone Age to the present.

authors.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
authors.biography: An American novelist and short story writer.

authors.name: Harper Lee
authors.biography: An American novelist known for 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

authors.name: Jane Austen
authors.biography: An English novelist known for her social commentary.

authors.name: J.D. Salinger
authors.biography: An American writer known for 'The Catcher in the Rye'.

authors.name: Mark Twain
authors.biography: An American author known for his novels about life along the Mississippi River.
